title: Blockchain-as-a-Service on Azure
author: Jeff Prosise
description: In this lab, you will deploy an Ethereum network on Azure and create your own cryptocurrency named My Coin to run on it. Please check the .md file for more info.

title: Using the Microsoft Custom Vision Service to Perform Image Classification
author: Jeff Prosise
description: In this lab, you will create a Custom Vision Service model, train it with images of famous paintings tagged with the artists' names, and utilize the model from a Node.js app to identify the artist of paintings that you upload. Along the way, you will learn how to train a Custom Vision Service model and leverage it from your apps using REST APIs. Please check the .md file for more info.

title: Building Interactive Notebooks with Azure Notebooks
author: Jeff Prosise
description: Create a notebook in Azure notebooks. Also manipulate, visualize, and analyze its data. Please check the .md file for more info.

title: Microsoft AI Workshop
author: Lauren Tran
description: This provides both a short deck to introduce ML/AI concepts and give a landscape of the Microsoft AI stack. It also provides a beginner workshop tutorial for Azure Machine Learning and a sample corresponding dataset. Please check the .md file for more info.

title: Building Neural Networks with the Microsoft Cognitive Toolkit
author: Jeff Prosise
description: In this lab, you will use the MNIST database to train and test a pair of neural networks, and then use the trained models to identify hand-written digits. Please check the .md file for more info.

title: Building Intelligent Bots with the Microsoft Bot Framework
author: Jeff Prosise
description: Software bots are everywhere. You probably interact with them every day without realizing it. Bots, especially chat and messenger bots, are changing the way we interact with businesses, communities, and even each other. In this lab, you'll be creating a chatbot. Please check the .md file for more info.

title: Microsoft Language Understanding Intelligent Service (LUIS)
author: Jeff Prosise
description: In this lab, you will create a LUIS application, configure a language-understanding model using both pre-built and custom entities, and define intents. Then you will build a bot that uses the model to respond to natural-language commands such as find news about Microsoft or get the latest soccer news. Please check the .md file for more info.

title: Azure Functions
author: Jeff Prosise
description: In this lab, you will create an Azure Function that monitors a blob container in Azure Storage for new images, and then performs automated analysis of the images using the Microsoft Cognitive Services Computer Vision API.  Please check the .md file for more info.

title: Using Microsoft Power BI to Explore and Visualize Data
author: Jeff Prosise
description: In this lab, you will use Microsoft Power BI to view sales data for a fictitious company and create reports and dashboards containing visualizations of that data. You will learn the basics of report creation and also learn various ways to share those reports with others, both internal and external to your organization. Please check the .md file for more info.

title: Handling Big Data with Azure Data Lake
author: Jeff Prosise
description: In this hands-on lab, you will learn how to: Create Data Lake Stores, Create Data Lake Analytics accounts and connect them to Data Lake Stores, Import data into Azure Data Lake Stores, Run U-SQL jobs in Azure Data Lake Analytics, Federate Azure SQL Databases and query them with U-SQL. Please check the respective .md file for more info.

title: Virtual Machine Scaling and Performance
author: Jeff Prosise
description: In this hands-on lab, you will run a compute-intensive job on three different Linux HPC clusters and compare performance. Please check the respective .md file for more info.

title: Building a Custom Dashboard in a Day
author: Jeff Prosise
description: The dataset you will you use today is a sales and market share analysis. This type of analysis is very common for the office of a Chief Marketing Officer (CMO). Please check the respective .md filee for more info.

title: Building your first Azure IOT Solution
author: Jeff Prosise
description: Azure IoT Suite brings the Internet of your things to life. Connect your devices, analyze previously-untapped data, and integrate business systems—and transform your company when you uncover new business models and revenue streams. Please check the .md file for more info.

title: Apache Hadoop & Spark
author: Jeff Prosise
description: Learn to use Apache Hadoop & Spark in this repo. Please check the respective .md files in each folder for more info.

title: Azure HPC and Azure Container Service
author: Jeff Prosise
description: Learn to run docker and clusters in this repo! Check both folders. Please check the respective .md files in each folder for more info.

title: Analyzing Data in Real Time with Azure Stream Analytics
author: Jeff Prosise
description: In this lab, you'll create an Azure Stream Analytics job and use it to analyze data streaming in from simulated Internet of Things (IoT) devices. And you'll see how simple it is to monitor real-time data streams for information of significance to your research or business. Check the .md file for more info!

title: Building Smart Apps with Azure Machine Learning
author: Jeff Prosise
description: In this lab, you will use Azure Machine Learning to build, train, and score a model that recognizes hand-written numeric digits. Check the .md file for more info!

title: Azure Storage and Cognitive Services
author: Jeff Prosise
description: In this lab, you will use Eclipse to write a Java Web site that accepts images uploaded by users and stores the images in Azure blob storage. Check the .md file for more info!

title: Azure Web Apps
author: Jeff Prosise
description: In this lab, you will use the cross-platform Visual Studio Code editor to build a Web site that uses PHP server-side scripting. Check the .md file for more info!

title: Introduction to Azure
author: Jeff Prosise
description: The purpose of this lab is to connect to the lab VM, log in to the Azure Portal, and confirm that you have a working subscription. Check the .md file for more info!

title: Django From Azure
author: Tim Reilly
description: This guide was designed to help a young developer get started developing for the web. It provides tools and configuration before deep diving into the Model, View, Controller architecture.Getting started with MVC is easy, and this was designed to make it even easier. This guide will also provide a context to practice source code management, tooling configuration, and working with repositories.As with most things technology, there will be a focus on the cloud. This means that our deployment will live in the cloud. Every change we make will be pushed to a live and active site that you can visit from anywhere in the world!So once you learn how to build, you will be familiar with deploying and managing.

title: Spark Core RGB Controller
author: MSP - Matt Pasco
description:
Windows App For Controlling a Spark Core
This is a sample windows 8.1 universal app that controls your sparkcore Check out Bret Stateham's tutorial on how to setup your spark core here: https://github.com/mspcontent/Spark-Core-Configuration

title: Socket.io Real Time Chess
author: David Washington
description: Mission: Real-time multiplayer chessSo, let’s make a multiplayer chess game that where when you make a move it’s reflected on your opponent’s screen in real-time. Instantly. Checkmate.

title: Multi-language Azure Web Sites with PHP, node.js, .NET
author: Scott and Stefan
description: Scott and Stefan dig into what's required of an Azure Web Site to run more than just ASP.NET. Why does a PHP app need a web.config? Can we run one site with more than one technology within it...and is that OK?

title: Xamarin.Forms Workshop
author: Pierce Boggan
description: Everything you need to run a workshop on Xamarin's native mobile cross platform apps

title: Xamarin Moments
author: Pierce Boggan
description: A SnapChat Clone made with Xamarin.Forms and Microsoft Azure

title: Xamarin Smart Coffee
author: Pierce Boggan
description: Brew a perfect cup of coffee from iOS and Android apps using Xamarin, Azure IoT Hub, and Microsoft Cognitive Services.

title: Xamarin Forms Samples
author: Xamarin
description: A collection of Xamarin Forms samples.

title: Using Azure Machine Learning to Predict Who Will Survive the Titanic
author: Jennifer Marsman
description: One of my “Introduction to Azure Machine Learning” talks demonstrates how to use Azure Machine Learning to make predictions.  The example I use is predicting whether a passenger on the Titanic will survive, given information like their age, gender, class of ticket, ticket fare, etc.  (You can download the Titanic dataset from Kaggle.)

title: How To Optimize Your March Madness Bracket with Azure Machine Learning
author: Jennifer Marsman
description: In the latest episode of DevRadio, I interviewed Damon Hachmeister from the Azure Machine Learning team.  Damon runs a competition for Microsoft employees to see who can best predict the results of the NCAA March Madness Tournament using Azure Machine Learning.  Last year, he won second place himself, and he walks us through his algorithm

title: Bot Workshop
author: Daniel Egan
description: Step-by-step instructions for the Node and C# projects are in a .docx file located BotWorkshop/CSharpWorkshop & BotWorkshop/NodeWorkshop folders.

title: Bot Builder SDK
author: Daniel Egan
description: The Microsoft Bot Builder SDK is one of three main components of the Microsoft Bot Framework. The Microsoft Bot Framework provides just what you need to build and connect intelligent bots that interact naturally wherever your users are talking, from text/sms to Skype, Slack, Office 365 mail and other popular services.

title: Bot Builder Samples
author: Daniel Egan
description: Bot Builder samples are organized into groups and designed to illustrate task-focused samples in C# and Node.js to help you build great bots! To use the samples clone our GitHub repository using Git.

title: MSP Hardware IoT Workshop
author: Eric Zhang
description: Slide deck for workshop focused on learning how to set up and use essential hardware in Microsoft Azure IoT kits for IoT development. This presentation discusses the fundamentals of developing an IoT project and covers a basic hands-on tutorial on debugging, and programming the Feather M0 and Featherwing to play Tetris.
